questions.title: Question 1: What is the primary inspiration for swarm robotics?
options: c. Collective behavior of social insects
questions.explanation: Swarm robotics is inspired by the collective behavior of social insects such as ants, bees, and termites.

questions.title: Question 2: What is a key characteristic of swarm robotics?
questions.explanation: Scalability is a key characteristic of swarm robotics, allowing the system to handle large numbers of robots effectively.

questions.title: Question 3: What is one of the main challenges in implementing swarm robotics?
questions.explanation: One of the main challenges in implementing swarm robotics is developing algorithms for effective coordination without central control.

questions.title: Question 4: What materials are commonly used in soft robotics?
questions.explanation: Elastomers are commonly used in soft robotics due to their high flexibility and elasticity.

questions.title: Question 5: Which application is ideal for soft robotics?
questions.explanation: Soft robotics is ideal for delicate object manipulation due to the flexibility and compliance of the materials used.

questions.title: Question 6: What is a major challenge in soft robotics?
questions.explanation: A major challenge in soft robotics is developing effective control and actuation systems for the flexible materials.

questions.title: Question 7: What is the goal of cognitive robotics?
options: c. Endowing robots with cognitive capabilities
questions.explanation: The goal of cognitive robotics is to endow robots with cognitive capabilities such as perception, reasoning, learning, and decision-making.

questions.title: Question 8: Which technology is crucial for cognitive robotics?
questions.explanation: Artificial intelligence (AI) is crucial for cognitive robotics, enabling robots to process data, recognize patterns, and make decisions.

questions.title: Question 9: What is a key application of cognitive robotics?
questions.explanation: A key application of cognitive robotics is social interaction with humans, using AI to understand and respond to human behavior.

questions.title: Question 10: What is bio-inspired robotics?
options: a. Robots inspired by human design
b. Robots that mimic biological systems
c. Robots that use artificial materials
questions.explanation: Bio-inspired robotics involves designing robots that mimic the structures, functions, and behaviors of biological organisms.

questions.title: Question 11: What is a common design approach in bio-inspired robotics?
questions.explanation: Biomimicry is a common design approach in bio-inspired robotics, where robots imitate the structures and functions of biological organisms.

questions.title: Question 12: What is a significant challenge in bio-inspired robotics?
questions.explanation: A significant challenge in bio-inspired robotics is finding suitable materials that can replicate the properties of biological tissues and ensuring their durability.
